  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Web Developer",
  "description": "Compovine Technologies Limited is an indigenous company with the main aim of offering Information Technology, Sales and Services to individuals and corporate organizations. Compovine Technology Limited currently has branches in Ibadan, Abuja, Lagos, Lokoja, Kano, Kaduna, Jos, Minna, Port Harcourt and Enugu, and we are still expanding.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Web Developer

Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Qualifictions


	Interested candidates should possess an HND / Bachelor`s Degree with 3 - 10 years of experience.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hr@compovine.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Web Developer Job at Compovine Technologies Limited




        
    

        
        Compovine Technologies Limited is an indigenous company with the main aim of offering Information Technology, Sales and Services to individuals and corporate organizations. Compovine Technology Limited currently has branches in Ibadan, Abuja, Lagos, Lokoja, Kano, Kaduna, Jos, Minna, Port Harcourt and Enugu, and we are still expanding.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Web Developer

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Qualifictions
     

            
    




	Interested candidates should possess an HND / Bachelor`s Degree with 3 - 10 years of experience.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@compovine.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Personal Assistant",
  "description": "Lisse Africa is a dynamic human resource consulting firm with key interest in recruitment with the aim of providing employees that are professional, verified and with a good cultural fit. At Lisse Africa, our aim is to build the world&#39;s most valued Recruitment Solution Company to Clients, Candidates, Colleagues and the communities where we work and live with regards to staff recruitment, background verification and other HR solutions.

We solely focus on the enhancement of client organizations by providing quality services on various aspects of their human resources and by letting the organization focus on its core issues.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Personal Assistant

Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time&nbsp;(On-site)

Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess an OND, HND, or Bachelor&#39;s Degree with 1-2 year of experience as a personal assistant.
	Must live within close proximity to Lekki phase 1
	Must be Male
	Must be able to work in a fast-paced environment.


Salary
N150,000 / Month.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;tegarecruits@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",
  "datePosted": "2026-01-16",
  "validThrough": "2026-02-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "LISSE AFRICA"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "193122"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 150000,
      "maxValue": 250000,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Personal Assistant Job at Lisse Africa




        
    

        
        Lisse Africa is a dynamic human resource consulting firm with key interest in recruitment with the aim of providing employees that are professional, verified and with a good cultural fit. At Lisse Africa, our aim is to build the world's most valued Recruitment Solution Company to Clients, Candidates, Colleagues and the communities where we work and live with regards to staff recruitment, background verification and other HR solutions.

We solely focus on the enhancement of client organizations by providing quality services on various aspects of their human resources and by letting the organization focus on its core issues.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Personal Assistant
     

            
    



Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time (On-site)

Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess an OND, HND, or Bachelor's Degree with 1-2 year of experience as a personal assistant.
	Must live within close proximity to Lekki phase 1
	Must be Male
	Must be able to work in a fast-paced environment.


Salary
N150,000 / Month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: tegarecruits@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Accountant",
  "description": "Amani Advisory Limited is committed to assisting organizations in achieving success by maximizing their most valuable resource - their employees. We offer complete HR solutions to businesses of all sizes and in various industries. Thanks to a team of seasoned HR professionals, we approach every project with expertise, innovation, and a client-centric mindset.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant

Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type:&nbsp;Hybrid
Industry: Fashion

Job Summary


	We are seeking a detail-oriented and reliable Accountant to manage the financial records of our fashion brand.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for maintaining accurate accounts, handling daily financial operations, and supporting management with timely financial reports.


Key Responsibilities


	Maintain accurate financial records and books of accounts
	Prepare daily, weekly, and monthly financial reports
	Manage accounts payable and receivable
	Monitor expenses, budgets, and cash flow
	Handle payroll processing and staff salary payments
	Reconcile bank statements and financial transactions
	Track inventory costs and production expenses
	Prepare and file statutory payments (PAYE, VAT, WHT, pensions, etc.)
	Support audit processes and ensure compliance with financial regulations
	Work closely with management to improve financial controls and profitability.


Requirements &amp; Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field
	Minimum of 2&ndash;4 years of experience (fashion or retail experience is an advantage)
	Strong knowledge of accounting principles and Nigerian tax regulations
	Proficiency in Excel and accounting software
	High level of accuracy, integrity, and attention to detail
	Ability to work independently and meet deadlines
	Good communication and reporting skills.


Salary
N250,000 - N300,000 monthly.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to:&nbsp;talent@amaniadvisory.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Accountant Job at Amani Advisory Limited




        
    

        
        Amani Advisory Limited is committed to assisting organizations in achieving success by maximizing their most valuable resource - their employees. We offer complete HR solutions to businesses of all sizes and in various industries. Thanks to a team of seasoned HR professionals, we approach every project with expertise, innovation, and a client-centric mindset.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant

Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Hybrid
Industry: Fashion

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a detail-oriented and reliable Accountant to manage the financial records of our fashion brand.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for maintaining accurate accounts, handling daily financial operations, and supporting management with timely financial reports.


Key Responsibilities


	Maintain accurate financial records and books of accounts
	Prepare daily, weekly, and monthly financial reports
	Manage accounts payable and receivable
	Monitor expenses, budgets, and cash flow
	Handle payroll processing and staff salary payments
	Reconcile bank statements and financial transactions
	Track inventory costs and production expenses
	Prepare and file statutory payments (PAYE, VAT, WHT, pensions, etc.)
	Support audit processes and ensure compliance with financial regulations
	Work closely with management to improve financial controls and profitability.


Requirements & Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field
	Minimum of 2–4 years of experience (fashion or retail experience is an advantage)
	Strong knowledge of accounting principles and Nigerian tax regulations
	Proficiency in Excel and accounting software
	High level of accuracy, integrity, and attention to detail
	Ability to work independently and meet deadlines
	Good communication and reporting skills.


Salary
N250,000 - N300,000 monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: talent@amaniadvisory.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Data Centre Operations Engineer",
  "description": "WIOCC is the leading player in the deployment of carrier-scale, future-proofed network infrastructure into Africa. We have the flexibility and scale to meet the ever-growing demand for reliable, high-speed capacity throughout Africa, driven by end consumers, enterprise users and the ecosystem that supports them. Our policy of continual investment in our network to create Africa&rsquo;s first, truly hyperscale network infrastructure means ongoing investment for growth, ensuring our readiness to meet the future data volume demands of end users throughout Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Data Centre Operations Engineer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Job type: Full-time (On-site)
Category: Operations
Reporting Line: Senior Operations Manager

Job Objective


	To manage, maintain, and optimize the infrastructure of our data center facilities.
	The ideal candidate will have deep expertise in power or cooling systems, a commitment to operational excellence, and the ability to respond effectively to technical challenges.
	This role is critical to ensuring uninterrupted operations and the availability of IT infrastructure in a fast-paced environment. This role will include normal day and night shift work.


Key Duties &amp; Responsibilities
Infrastructure Management:


	Operate and maintain critical infrastructure systems, including power distribution, cooling systems, cabling, and environmental monitoring.
	Perform routine inspections and preventive maintenance to ensure optimal performance of infrastructure systems.
	Monitor the data center environment (temperature, humidity, airflow) to ensure adherence to operational standards.


Preventive and Predictive Maintenance:


	Develop and execute preventive maintenance schedules for all data center infrastructure and systems.
	Identify potential issues through predictive analysis and implement solutions proactively to prevent downtime.
	Ensure detailed documentation of maintenance activities and updates to standard operating procedures (SOPs).


Incident Response and Troubleshooting:


	Respond swiftly to incidents, diagnosing root causes, and implementing corrective actions.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams, clients, service providers and OEM suppliers during outages or emergencies to minimize business impact.


Capacity Planning and Upgrades:


	Assist in capacity planning to support the data center&rsquo;s current and future needs.
	Participate in the design, review, and implementation of infrastructure upgrades or expansions.


Compliance and Safety:


	Ensure adherence to industry standards, local regulations, and best practices (e.g., IEEE, and local electrical codes).
	Maintain a safe working environment by adhering to safety protocols and conducting regular safety audits.


Monitoring and Performance Optimization:


	Utilize Data Center Infrastructure Management (DCIM) tools to monitor power usage, efficiency, and performance metrics.
	Implement strategies to improve energy efficiency and reduce power usage effectiveness (PUE).


Vendor and Contractor Management:


	Coordinate with external vendors and contractors for the maintenance, repair, and installation of all data center infrastructure and systems.
	Review and approve vendor work to ensure compliance with standards and quality expectations.


Minimum Qualifications


	3+ years of experience in electrical systems within data centers, industrial environments, or critical infrastructure facilities.
	Strong knowledge of data center infrastructure systems, including power, cooling, and cabling.
	Familiarity with key tools and software, such as access management, ticketing systems and DCIM platforms.


Preferred Skills and Certifications:


	Certified Data Center Professional (CDCP) or Certified Data Center Specialist (CDCS).
	Certifications in electrical or HVAC systems or other relevant certifications.
	Familiarity with Generators, UPS or HVAC technologies and their maintenance.
	Knowledge of safety standards like OSHA 85.


Soft Skills:


	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.
	Ability to work effectively in high-pressure situations and adapt to rapidly changing environments.
",
  "datePosted": "2026-01-16",
  "validThrough": "2026-02-16",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "WIOCC Nigeria Limited"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "193111"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Data Centre Operations Engineer Job at WIOCC Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        WIOCC is the leading player in the deployment of carrier-scale, future-proofed network infrastructure into Africa. We have the flexibility and scale to meet the ever-growing demand for reliable, high-speed capacity throughout Africa, driven by end consumers, enterprise users and the ecosystem that supports them. Our policy of continual investment in our network to create Africa’s first, truly hyperscale network infrastructure means ongoing investment for growth, ensuring our readiness to meet the future data volume demands of end users throughout Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Data Centre Operations Engineer
     

            
    



Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time (On-site)
Category: Operations
Reporting Line: Senior Operations Manager

Job Objective


	To manage, maintain, and optimize the infrastructure of our data center facilities.
	The ideal candidate will have deep expertise in power or cooling systems, a commitment to operational excellence, and the ability to respond effectively to technical challenges.
	This role is critical to ensuring uninterrupted operations and the availability of IT infrastructure in a fast-paced environment. This role will include normal day and night shift work.


Key Duties & Responsibilities
Infrastructure Management:


	Operate and maintain critical infrastructure systems, including power distribution, cooling systems, cabling, and environmental monitoring.
	Perform routine inspections and preventive maintenance to ensure optimal performance of infrastructure systems.
	Monitor the data center environment (temperature, humidity, airflow) to ensure adherence to operational standards.


Preventive and Predictive Maintenance:


	Develop and execute preventive maintenance schedules for all data center infrastructure and systems.
	Identify potential issues through predictive analysis and implement solutions proactively to prevent downtime.
	Ensure detailed documentation of maintenance activities and updates to standard operating procedures (SOPs).


Incident Response and Troubleshooting:


	Respond swiftly to incidents, diagnosing root causes, and implementing corrective actions.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams, clients, service providers and OEM suppliers during outages or emergencies to minimize business impact.


Capacity Planning and Upgrades:


	Assist in capacity planning to support the data center’s current and future needs.
	Participate in the design, review, and implementation of infrastructure upgrades or expansions.


Compliance and Safety:


	Ensure adherence to industry standards, local regulations, and best practices (e.g., IEEE, and local electrical codes).
	Maintain a safe working environment by adhering to safety protocols and conducting regular safety audits.


Monitoring and Performance Optimization:


	Utilize Data Center Infrastructure Management (DCIM) tools to monitor power usage, efficiency, and performance metrics.
	Implement strategies to improve energy efficiency and reduce power usage effectiveness (PUE).


Vendor and Contractor Management:


	Coordinate with external vendors and contractors for the maintenance, repair, and installation of all data center infrastructure and systems.
	Review and approve vendor work to ensure compliance with standards and quality expectations.


Minimum Qualifications


	3+ years of experience in electrical systems within data centers, industrial environments, or critical infrastructure facilities.
	Strong knowledge of data center infrastructure systems, including power, cooling, and cabling.
	Familiarity with key tools and software, such as access management, ticketing systems and DCIM platforms.


Preferred Skills and Certifications:


	Certified Data Center Professional (CDCP) or Certified Data Center Specialist (CDCS).
	Certifications in electrical or HVAC systems or other relevant certifications.
	Familiarity with Generators, UPS or HVAC technologies and their maintenance.
	Knowledge of safety standards like OSHA 85.


Soft Skills:


	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.
	Ability to work effectively in high-pressure situations and adapt to rapidly changing environments.
    

    

        Click here to Apply
